source_note: State baseline derived from Rhode Island Resource Recovery Corporation (RIRRC) and state recycling laws.

organics.guidance: Food scrap recycling required for large generators under R.I. Gen. Laws §23-18.9-17; residents encouraged to compost.
organics.bin: Green bin or food scrap drop-off.
organics.notes: Municipal composting expanding under RIRRC support.

paper_cardboard.guidance: Recycle clean paper and cardboard; flatten boxes.

glass_containers.guidance: Recycle glass bottles and jars (rinsed, no lids).

metal_containers.guidance: Recycle aluminum and steel/tin cans (clean and empty).

plastics.guidance: Recycle rigid plastics labeled #1–#7; keep loose, not bagged.
plastics.notes: Plastic bags and film not accepted curbside.

beverage_containers_crv.guidance: Rhode Island has no container deposit program.

household_batteries.guidance: Recycle rechargeable and lead-acid batteries through HHW events or retail drop-offs.

e_waste.guidance: E-waste recycling required under the RI E-Waste Recycling Program.

plastic_bags_and_film.guidance: Plastic bags banned in most municipalities; film accepted at store drop-offs.
plastic_bags_and_film.bin: Retail drop-off for film and wraps.
plastic_bags_and_film.notes: Reusable bags required in retail stores.
provenance: Municipal plastic bag bans; RIRRC recycling info

bulky_items.guidance: Bulky waste must be scheduled for pickup or delivered to landfill.
